installation.hackintosh:
Thank you for using TINU

If you want to use this macOS system on an hackintosh, please download and install either the Clover or the OpenCore bootloader, you can find Clover here:
 https://github.com/CloverHackyColor/CloverBootloader/releases

or OpenCore here:
 https://github.com/acidanthera/OpenCorePkg/releases 

(note that the bootloaders mentioned needs to be installed and configured properly depending on the hw configuration of the system you want to install on, for help about that go to: www.insanelymac.com or r/Hackintosh)

If you want to use this macOS system on a standard mac, you don`t have to do any extra steps, it`s ready to be used.
installation.mac:
Thank you for using TINU

Remember that this macOS installation will work just with macs officially supported by the version of the OS you choose and not with unsupported machines

installer.hackintosh:
Thank you for using TINU

If you want to use this bootable macOS installer on an hackintosh, please download and install either the Clover or the OpenCore bootloader, you can find Clover here:
 https://github.com/CloverHackyColor/CloverBootloader/releases

or OpenCore here:
 https://github.com/acidanthera/OpenCorePkg/releases 

(note that the bootloaders mentioned needs to be installed and configured properly depending on the hw configuration of the system you want to install on, for help about that go to: www.insanelymac.com or r/Hackintosh)

If you want to use this bootable macOS installer on a standard mac, you don`t have to do any extra steps, it`s ready to be used.
installer.mac:
Thank you for using TINU

Remember that this installer will work just with macs officially supported by the version of macOS you choose and not with unsupported machines

helpfoulMessange.installer:
******************************************

Note that:

-This process may take a lot of time (usually between 5 and 50 minutes) especially with slow storage devices (like Hard drives, SD/micro SD cards and virtual disks) and slow machines (like most virtual machines), so be patient and wait for it to finish

-If you feel nothing is happening or the program is stuck remeber that TINU is just waiting for the program, createinstallmedia, to take care of the foundamental steps of this process, without knowing when it will finish his opearation. So TINU it's not stuck, it's just waiting.

-The progress shown in the progress bar is just to give to the user the impression of busyness and that something is happening, so that's only cosmethic, but it's not actual progress since there is not a consistent way of obtaining accurate progress values during this step. TINU is just making the bar going forward by using a timer which increments it each few seconds for 50 minutes.

-For more help or questions go to |Menu bar| -> |TINU| -> |Related to TINU| -> |Contact us| there you will find all the links and the contacts related to this project (NOTE: this doesn't work when TINU is running in a macOS recovery environment).

******************************************
helpfoulMessange.installation:
******************************************

Note that:

-This process may take a lot of time (usually between 5 and 50 minutes) especially with slow storage devices (like Hard drives, SD/micro SD cards and virtual disks) and slow machines (like most virtual machines), so be patient and wait for it to finish

-If you feel nothing is happening or the program is stuck remeber that TINU is just waiting for the program, startosinstall, to take care of the foundamental steps of this process, without knowing when it will finish his opearation. So TINU it's not stuck, it's just waiting.

-The progress shown in the progress bar is just to give to the user the impression of busyness and that something is happening, so that's only cosmethic, but it's not actual progress since there is not a consistent way of obtaining accurate progress values during this step. TINU is just making the bar going forward by using a timer which increments it each few seconds for 50 minutes.

-For more help or questions go to |Menu bar| -> |TINU| -> |Related to TINU| -> |Contact us| there you will find all the links and the contacts related to this project (NOTE: this doesn't work when TINU is running in a macOS recovery environment).

******************************************

installer.title: Create a copy of TINU on the installer
installer.desc:
Creates a copy of this application inside the choosen drive.
Once you boot into the USB installer you can open TINU by performing this command into the terminal:

/Volumes/Image\ Volume/TINU.app/Contents/MacOS/TINU

Using TINU in this way it allows you to create bootable macOS installers from a macOS installer/recovery or allows you to install macOS from TINU.

Works only with Mac OS X El Capitan or newer versions of the macOS installer/macOS recovery.

installer.title: Create the "README" file on the installer
installer.desc: Creates a README file on the target drive. The content of this file is just a thank you messange and a reminder for some users.

installer.title: Apply the macOS installer's icon to the installer
installer.desc: Applys the macOS icon from the macOS installer app to the target drive.

installer.title: Format the choosen drive entirely
installer.desc:
Erases all the contentent of the choosen storage device, and then formats it using a macOS Extended Journaled (HFS+) main partition with the GUID partition table for the drive.
This operation is mandatory (and it will be performed automatically) if you chose a drive.

installer.title: Create the .AIBootFiles folder, if it's not present
installer.desc: For hackintosh usage: Older version of Clover (released before macOS 10.13.4) may not recognize or boot a bootable macOS installer without the invisible folder called .IABootFiles, so this option creates one automatically.

installer.title: Delete the .IAPhisicalMedia file from the installer
installer.desc: For hackintosh usage: Older version of Clover (released before macOS 10.13.4) may not recognize or boot a bootable macOS installer which contains the .IAPhysicalMedia file, so this option remooves it automatically.

installer.title: Don't unmount the EFI partition
installer.desc: While creating the bootable macOS installer, TINU may mount it's EFI partition, this option prevents TINU from unmounting it after it finishes the creation process.

installation.title: Install TINU on the system
installation.desc:
Installs a copy of TINU in the /Applications folder of the newly installed macOS system.

Requires Mac OS X El Capitan or newer versions of macOS

installation.title: Create the "README" file on the system
installation.desc: Creates a README file on the target drive. The content of this file is just a thank you messange and a reminder for some users.

installation.title: Apply the macOS icon to the system volume
installation.desc: Applys the macOS icon from the macOS version to the installation volume.

installation.title: Format the choosen drive entirely
installation.desc:
Erases all the contentent of the choosen storage device, and then formats it using a macOS Extended Journaled (HFS+) main partition with the GUID partition table for the drive.
This operation is mandatory (and it will be performed automatically) if you chose a drive.

installation.title: Install macOS avoiding automatic APFS upgrade
installation.desc: Forces the macOS installer to not convert the target volume to the APFS file system (Available only with macOS High Sierra).

unmutable.license: Released under the GNU GPL V3 License

content.installer:
• Make sure that your disk device is working, e.g. by copying files to it.

• Verify that any adapters, cables or devices you use to attach your disk device to the computer are correctly plugged in, working, and if needed, correctly installed, and that your version of macOS does work with these particular devices, adapters or peripherals you are using.

• Make sure the disk device you have chosen is a physical device and not a virtual device. Virtual devices may not work properly with this app.

• TINU only recognizes disks and partitions that are usable to create bootasble macOS installers, so make sure the disk/partition you want to use is large enough (at least 8GB or at least 9GB if you want to create a Catalina installer and at least 13GB if you want to create an installer of Big Sur and later, and in the case of a partition, also make sure that it is part of a disk that uses the GUID or GPT format and that it's not of the APFS type).

• Make sure that the partition you want to use is not part of your computer's startup disk and that it is not your mac's internal hard drive or SSD.

• Before using this app try to format, the drive you want to use, using Disk Utility and choosing the format "macOS Extended (journaled)".
content.installation:
• Make sure that your disk device is working, e.g. by copying files to it.

• Verify that any adapters, cables or devices you use to attach your disk device to the computer are correctly plugged in, working, and if needed, correctly installed, and that your version of macOS does work with these particular devices, adapters or peripherals you are using.

• Make sure the disk device you have chosen is a physical device and not a virtual device. Virtual devices may not work properly with this app.

• TINU only recognizes disks and partitions that are usable to install macOS on them, so make sure the disk/partition you want to use is large enough (at least 20 GB or at least 30GB if you want to install Catalina or Big Sur and later versions, and in the case of a partition, also make sure that it is part of a disk that uses the GUID or GPT format).

• Try to format it in Disk Utility using the "macOS Extended (journaled)" format before using it with this app.

unmutable.title: To make sure that your storage device will be detected:

unmutable.desc:
This option automatically installs the selected ${bootloader} EFI folder inside the EFI partition of the drive "${drive}".
Only UEFI 64Bits ${bootloader} EFI folders are supported.
unmutable.title: ${bootloader} EFI folder installer
unmutable.errorDialog: There was an unkown error while trying to open the selcted EFI folder
unmutable.improperDialogTitle: The folder "${pathName}" is not a proper ${bootloader} efi folder
unmutable.improperDialog: The folder you selected "${path}" does not contain the required element "${missing}", make sure to open just the folder named EFI and that it cointains all the needed elements
unmutable.alreadyChoosen: You have already choosen a ${bootloader} EFI folder
